feed.title: QDRG@EAIFR
feed.subtitle: The Quantum Dynamics Research Group (QDRG) at ICTP-East African Institute for Fundamental Research, University of Rwanda focuses on developing and using quantum dynamics methods to study processes relevant to atmopsheric chemistry, astrophysics, combustion and catalysis.

entry.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at Rutgers-Newark Physics.

link.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at Rutgers-Newark Physics.

entry.content: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the Rutgers-Newark Summer Theory Workshop on Molecules and Materials: design and Dynamics.
entry.summary: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the Rutgers-Newark Summer Theory Workshop on Molecules and Materials: design and Dynamics.

entry.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at the ES22 meeting.

link.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at the ES22 meeting.

entry.content: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the 2022 Workshop on Recent Developments in Electronic Structure (ES22). The meeting, hosted by Columbia University, was an opportunity to celebrate Prof Richard Martin 80th birthday.
entry.summary: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the 2022 Workshop on Recent Developments in Electronic Structure (ES22). The meeting, hosted by Columbia University, was an opportunity to celebrate Prof Richard Martin 80th birthday.

entry.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at the USAFRI workshop.

link.title: Steve Ndengué presented his work at the USAFRI workshop.

entry.content: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the online US-Africa Initiative on Electronic Structure (USAFRI) workshop.
entry.summary: Steve Ndengué presented his work with collaborators from France and Germany on the infrared spectroscopy of the water-dimer at the online US-Africa Initiative on Electronic Structure (USAFRI) workshop.

entry.title: Members of the EXAF team attend the MLESMD.

link.title: Members of the EXAF team attend the MLESMD.

entry.content: Ayda, Sosthene and Steve attended the week long Machine Learning in Electronic Structure and Molecular Dynamics workshop organized by ICTP-EAIFR and ICTP and hosted at the Institute. It is the first in-person meeting at ICTP-EAIFR since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.
entry.summary: Ayda, Sosthene and Steve attended the week long Machine Learning in Electronic Structure and Molecular Dynamics workshop organized by ICTP-EAIFR and ICTP and hosted at the Institute. It is the first in-person meeting at ICTP-EAIFR since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: Members of the group attend the MLESMD.

link.title: Members of the group attend the MLESMD.

entry.content: The members of the QDRG attended the week long Machine Learning in Electronic Structure and Molecular Dynamics workshop organized by ICTP-EAIFR and ICTP and hosted at the Institute. It is the first in-person meeting at ICTP-EAIFR since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.

link.title: Members of the EXAF team participate to an ICTP ML woorkhop.

entry.content: Ayda and Sosthene participated to the week long online Young Researchers’ Workshop on Machine Learning for Materials organized by ICTP.
entry.summary: Ayda and Sosthene participated to the week long online Young Researchers’ Workshop on Machine Learning for Materials organized by ICTP.

entry.title: Wala Elsayed joined the group.
entry.content: Wala Elsayed got her Master’s in Chemistry from the University of Khartoum, Sudan. Her PhD is supported by the Organisation for Women in Science for the Developing World (OWSD).
entry.summary: Wala Elsayed got her Master’s in Chemistry from the University of Khartoum, Sudan. Her PhD is supported by the Organisation for Women in Science for the Developing World (OWSD).

entry.title: Ange Benise Niyikiza joined the group.

link.title: Ange Benise Niyikiza joined the group.

entry.content: Ange Benise Niyikiza got her BSc in Physics from the University of Rwanda, Rwanda. Her Master’s project, in collaboration with Prof Fabien Gatti of University Paris-Saclay, will be on quantum control of molecular processes for quantum technologies applications in chemistry.
entry.summary: Ange Benise Niyikiza got her BSc in Physics from the University of Rwanda, Rwanda. Her Master’s project, in collaboration with Prof Fabien Gatti of University Paris-Saclay, will be on quantum control of molecular processes for quantum technologies applications in chemistry.

entry.title: Mr Sosthene Irambona and Dr Ayda Badri joined the EXAF Team.

link.title: Mr Sosthene Irambona and Dr Ayda Badri joined the EXAF Team.

entry.content: Mr Sosthene Irambona and Dr Ayda Badri joined our EXAF Team. Sosthene Irambona got his Master’s in Mathematical Science from AIMS South Africa and is an Assistant Lecturer at Rwanda Polytechnic, Musanze. Ayda Badri got her PhD in Molecular Physics in the LSAMA lab of University of Tunis El Manar.
entry.summary: Mr Sosthene Irambona and Dr Ayda Badri joined our EXAF Team. Sosthene Irambona got his Master’s in Mathematical Science from AIMS South Africa and is an Assistant Lecturer at Rwanda Polytechnic, Musanze. Ayda Badri got her PhD in Molecular Physics in the LSAMA lab of University of Tunis El Manar.
